name: Full rig underworld Kate
description:
The idea is to hostage PC and underworld contact as fast as you can and start poking different servers. It is a bit slow start but you can slowly building your rig along the way by upgrading your breaker with personal touch. I would like to squeeze in mimic as early game sentry breaker before garrote is out but I don't know what to cut. I even want to swap out akamatsu mem chip with dyson mem chip to get the economy rolling as fast as possible but I am afraid too many links might be overkill.

Any suggestion/ thoughts?

name: 1.3.2.4.2 HB Drain Bamage
description:
The main premise here is pretty straightforward: land a brain damage or two while trying to rush some agendas. If the Runner gets careless, or takes way too much brain damage, Neural EMPs can ruin someone’s day. And Whirlpool->Howler is the goal for inflicting some pain, should the opportunity arise.

If you see any ways this could be improved, please let me know.

name: KATE：LLDS+disposable breaker
The gold crown
description: Here is the trick: test run the best program early, and scavenge/eureka it afterwards to avoid paying for it. Recur with same old thing if necessary. Best first targets seem to be Femme and Torch. Your optimal rig is minimal : 3 breakers and a few resources. If you need it, Dinosaurus is there to scavenge a Morning Star or Garrote on it, or to be able to play the two Femme with a decoder and a fracter on the table.

name: Weyland Fast Advance
Andro V3
DoppelKate.
The Screamer!
description: This deck defends early, then lures the runner into a whirlpool + howler + Janus trap. Howler can also be used to lock the runner out of a remote.

name: Go Rin No Sho
description: Runner killer Jinteki deck splashing HB

name: NBN - T&B V1
Meat Time
Jinteki v2.0 ++ SuperExtreme Z
The "Sysop" Runner (Caïssa Deck)
description:
In this deck the main purpose is to take control of the Corp ICE.

With the classic combo Reina-Xanadu-Rook you can make the Corp pay 4 credits even to rezz a Pop-up Window (as the first rezzed). This can make the first runs safe even with no icebrakers when the Corp has a low economy. Forged Activation Orders will make the Corp spend some credits on another server maybe just to be sure.

Emergency Shutdown and Kraken will do the rest of the trick, create economy problems and weaken the servers.

Knight is able to face almost any big ICE while i find the standard Anarch icebreaker Rig strong enough to face the rest of little ICE with low economic effort. Bishop will help these non Caïssa icebreakers (better than Parasite in this deck as it will use the Mem from Deep Red and has some mobility and a fixed debuff) while Datasucker will support also Knight for BIGGER ICE (Wotan, Janus etc.).

The e3 Feedback Implants will help to break subroutines with Knight and if you are "lucky" to encounter Bioroids you can break them with little effort even with no icebreaker.

Pawns and Déjà Vu will help to take some staff from the heap.

The economy should be enough as the objective is to face fewer ICE as possible.

name: Kate McGadget
Next Level
description: Includes lots of cheaper ice to support NEXT Design and Accelerated Beta Test. Click intensive economy with Efficiency Committee, Gila, & Melange.

name: HB neurocaustic
description: first corp deck...brain damage, brain damage...whirlpools to lock the runner in with tyr's hand and howler hopefully making the run too expensive...also some ambushes thrown in for added nastiness...

name: Chaos Theories 3.0
description: CT with no console, just her built in memory. Lightweight rig with recurring one-shot options.

name: Runner Shutdown
description:
Top Corp deck in the 2013-14 Season Three Tournament at Denver Central Games played on Saturday, January 25th. There were eight players. Its record was 4-0-1 in five games. Three were won through meat damage. The fourth was won in points.

I heard about this "broken strategy" on a podcast that didn't sound so good to me so I decided to give it a shot to see if it would work. It's been doing much better than I anticipated.

Main Strategy: Built to trigger a combo whereby you tag the runner and then play 2 or 3 Scorched Earths in one turn.

Sample Meat-Kill Methods: 1) Posted Bounty, Scorched, Scorched 2) Score ready-to-go Posted Bounty, Power Shutdown whole deck, Jackson Accelerated Diagnostics Scorched Scorched, draw, play Accelerated Diagnostics

Note: The following methods require the Runner to have run last turn.

3) SEA Source, Scorched, Scorched 4) Power Shutdown whole deck, Jackson in SEA Source Scorched Scorched, play Accelerated Diagnostics, play third Scorched from hand (if necessary) 5) Play SEA Source from hand, Power Shutdown whole deck, Jackson in Scorched Scorched Scorched, play Accelerated Diagnostics

Considerations: 1) You often can kill the runner in just two clicks. That third click and an extra Power Shutdown can sometimes be used to get rid of a pesky Carapace or Decoy. 2) Beware a Noise that can put out Viruses mid-turn and skim the top card off your deck mid-combo. Though, sometimes you can still pull it off (especially if that SEA Source is in hand). 3) There are very few ICE in this deck, but one big one will slow the runner considerably. If you are playing a Runner that can hop big ICE easily; you will are more likely to lose. However, if you draw like a maniac to get that combo while using spare Jacksons to cycle agendas back through you stand a good chance of winning. 4) A feasible secondary strategy is to get out a big ICE early and then quickly advance agendas behind it before the runner can get through. The agendas often help buy time for or trigger your combo anyhow, so there's less loss in attempting it. 5) Don't mess up your math (:

Math Shortcut: A guaranteed SEA Source will cost the Runner's credits + link (minimum 2).

Tournament Info Link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1iVDi3BA9oy8kXKXdC0Fs3TLHKcwgYAJTsIZ84F01DhY/edit?usp=sharing

name: Central Control Kate v2
description:
Know stuff, control stuff!

Keep centrals de-iced or cheap to break with Parasite/Atman/Corroder as necessary.

Keyhole/Indexing for smart R&D check-ins. Record Reconstructor for slowing the Corps pace, giving back ice at Atman's installed strength.

Woman in the Red Dress for HQ knowledge and milling pace (it goes faster than you think if you get Keyhole/WitRD out early).

Oh, and passive/draw economy!

name: ChaosRush.o8d
